image.altText: An older woman teaches a younger woman how to knit

props.synopsis: In a country town near Canberra, a program run by an aged care provider and the local high school is seeing positive results in breaking down barriers between younger and older community members.

title.children: How the generation gap is being bridged in this country town

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie

props.synopsis: Former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann takes his appeal to the High Court against the findings that he, on the balance of probabilities, raped Brittany Higgins in 2019.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann launches High Court appeal in latest defamation battle round

image.altText: Police tape in the foreground, a police car near a home in the distance.

props.synopsis: NSW Police launch an investigation after an unidentified woman was found dead in a home in Goulburn on Saturday morning.

title.children: NSW Police investigating woman's death at Goulburn home

image.altText: A woman's hands hold a key ring while resting on a park bench.

props.synopsis: A 24-year-old NSW border resident says dismissive treatment in hospitals, long waits for care and limited access to services have pushed her away from support.

title.children: Patient says 'traumatising' hospital care deepened her mental health crisis

image.altText: a wide shot of a flat beach, with a small headland in the distance.

props.synopsis: A 20-year-old man speaks of rescuing three people from rough water on his paddleboard, including a 34-year-old man who was declared dead after he was brought onto the beach.

title.children: Two drownings in two days along NSW South Coast as man dies at Jervis Bay

image.altText: Three uniformed police officers walking on a road blocked off with orange cones.

props.synopsis: In just four minutes, two men were stabbed in the chest and customers inside the Queanbeyan hair salon were left shaken.

title.children: Bikies allegedly sat waiting in hair salon before stabbing two men

props.synopsis: Fast to build, eco-friendly and affordable: modular and pre-fabricated homes have been touted as a possible solution to Australia's housing crisis, but manufacturers and suppliers say changes are needed to reduce costs and meet demand.

title.children: Are modular homes the key to solving the ACT's housing crisis?

image.altText: Artificial intelligence is growing smarter

props.synopsis: Artificial intelligence is a controversial subject, but as the debate rages it is already being used by ACT government departments, doctors and the people running firefighting operations.

title.children: How you're already relying on AI, even if you think you're not

image.altText: Two men kissing in front of a car.

props.synopsis: What started as a chance discovery of an old photo at a Dallas antique store has spawned a collection of more than 4,000 images of male couples, more than 100 of which are now on display in Canberra.

title.children: It was a photo that, if leaked, was illegal. Now it's on public display

image.altText: Birds eye view of a housing estate with an oval and park towards the bottom of the image

props.synopsis: Thousands of young trees dot the streets and front gardens of this outer Melbourne suburb as part of a neighbourhood-wide push to create more shade and curb the urban heat island effect.

title.children: Tree by tree, this new suburb is dodging baking heat in summer

image.altText: A person leans on an oval fence while kids stand nearby with bikes in front of a large round hole in the green grass.

props.synopsis: A sinkhole has opened up in Banyule Flats Reserve, close to where a North East Link tunnel boring machine is operating.

title.children: Banyule locals blame North East Link for sinkhole at football oval

image.altText: Brigitte Macron walking with black glasses.

props.synopsis: Several defendants told the court their comments were intended as humour or satire.

title.children: Paris court finds 10 people guilty of cyberbullying Brigitte Macron

image.altText: Albanese gestures at a podium

props.synopsis: A group of former Labor MPs, senators and party officials have signed an open letter asking Anthony Albanese to call a national royal commission into the Bondi terror attack.

title.children: Prominent Labor figures join calls for antisemitism royal commission

image.altText: A long view of a Venezuelan oil refinery at dusk.

props.synopsis: Australian shares are set to jump as the price of oil makes a comeback. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX set to rise as oil price jumps after strike on Venezuela

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: BlueScope at the top of the ASX
Investors shrug off strikes by US

image.altText: Travis Head holds two bats up towards the crowd as he walks off the field

props.synopsis: In what has been a bowlers' series, the class of Joe Root and Travis Head again shone on day two in Sydney, where it often took something silly for a wicket to fall.

title.children: Batting class prevails for Head and Root on a fiery day in Sydney

image.altText: drawing of a young girl using the phone in bed at night, next to an image of a man on a laptop in a hoodie.

props.synopsis: Child safety experts say the case of a 13-year-old girl who became pregnant while in state care highlights the dangers of the residential system.

title.children: Teenage girl sexually assaulted and pregnant while in state care

image.altText: Richard Turner looks over his shoulder looking stern and serious, with his arms slightly folded in front of him.

props.synopsis: When survivors of child sexual abuse receive compensation, many may have to repay Centrelink, Medicare and private health insurance amounts relating to their abuse.

title.children: Insurance, Centrelink repayments 'final nail in coffin' for abuse survivors

image.altText: A car bogged in mud

props.synopsis: A traveller is in hospital after walking through knee-deep mud after he became bogged in outback Queensland on Saturday.

title.children: Man walks 40 kilometres after getting bogged amid outback floods

image.altText: Blonde woman wearing red T-shirt and jeans with arms up.

props.synopsis: Dozens of people from multiple states have come forward after allegedly falling victim to a new pet and house-sitting scam orchestrated by career con artist Patricia McIntyre.

title.children: Serial fraudster allegedly targeting pet and home owners in scam

image.altText: Tonya Harding skates past Nancy Kerrigan.

props.synopsis: The genteel and sequined world of figure skating had its dark side exposed in a drama worthy of a soap opera in 1994, as Nancy Kerrigan was the victim of a dastardly plot to eliminate her from the Winter Olympics.

title.children: How a sour rivalry thrust figure skating into the realm of soap opera

image.altText: A lifesaver watches over Main Beach on North Stradbroke Island.

props.synopsis: Surf lifesavers are rethinking their iconic beach safety message after multiple drownings at remote or unpatrolled swim spots in NSW.

title.children: Lifesavers say 'swim between flags' message not enough after drownings

image.altText: A generated image of people walking towards a stadium

props.synopsis: The new stadium will host the opening and closing ceremonies and athletics at the 2032 Games, before becoming the city’s main stadium with 63,000 seats.

title.children: Queensland government unveils plans for Olympic stadium

image.altText: A man sitting at a table.

props.synopsis: Australia's energy prices continue to soar as questions continue to be raised about the actions of providers, including by this pensioner who was overcharged and then had debt collectors chasing him.

title.children: How a 'ruthless' energy company went after a pensioner for money he didn't owe

image.altText: A pink substance in the beach tide.

props.synopsis: Scientists say a bioluminescent algae causes the red tides at the centre of recent environmentalist concerns — but that's not to say the magnificent display is totally harmless to marine life.

title.children: Is Tasmania's 'red tide' a brilliant light show or an environmental problem?

image.altText: Two women sitting on chairs wearing hats and sunglasses, fishing from a jetty

props.synopsis: An algal bloom that has been ravaging parts of SA's coast for months is pushing visitors to head to other parts of the state.

title.children: Algae fears boost business in unaffected SA tourist towns

image.altText: A red up arrow next to a percentage sign on top of an aerial view of dozens of houses.

props.synopsis: Mortgage borrowers and savers may have used the new year as an excuse to get their financial affairs in order, but things may be set to change within a matter of months.

title.children: Here's what to expect from the RBA this year with rate hikes on the table

image.altText: A man with a black towel draped over his head is questioned by media

props.synopsis: Muamer Nukic, a 50-year-old Queensland Police Service employee and described as a "self-proclaimed anti-Zionist" was granted bail in the Brisbane Magistrate Court on Monday.

title.children: Police employee faces court over alleged antisemitic online posts

image.altText: The rural driveway of a prison with a sign reading "Langi Kal Kal"

props.synopsis: A farm worker says he was threatened by a man who escaped from Langi Kal Kal prison near Ballarat.

title.children: Prison escapee attacks Victorian farm worker

image.altText: Coco Gauff plays a forehand at United Cup.

props.synopsis: The US secures a United Cup quarterfinal berth after Coco Gauff makes up for a shock singles loss by helping win the deciding mixed doubles rubber.

title.children: Gauff goes from cold to hot as US makes United Cup quarterfinals

image.altText: A man in a black zipped jumper holds a water bottle and walks past a Manchester United logo on a black wall

props.synopsis: It comes less than a day after the club drew one-all with Leeds United and a testy post-match press conference in which Amorim questioned his own role and the club's management.

title.children: Manchester United sacks head coach Ruben Amorim

image.altText: A woman with glasses looks at the camera in front of a huge monstera plant in a rattan vase

props.synopsis: Hundreds of people have accessed South Australia's Donor Conception Register in its first year, lifting decades of secrecy surrounding anonymous donations — an outcome that has prompted calls from a leading advocate for similar moves at national level.

title.children: Katherine may have 700 half-siblings. She's trying to find them to pass on medical advice

image.altText: various views of Sydney Harbour from Woolwich marina and Kelly's Bush

props.synopsis: Local groups that helped save heritage-listed Kelly's Bush Park from being impacted by a marina expansion proposal are calling on the NSW government to do more to protect the foreshore.

title.children: 'Money talks': Big win to stop Sydney marina expansion could be short-lived

image.altText: Woman with red shirt and dark hair

props.synopsis: Born from her own experience, a Townsville woman is encouraging businesses to offer 'DV safe spaces' for those who are experiencing domestic and family violence.

title.children: Samantha's ex made her feel unsafe in public, she's now reclaiming spaces

image.altText: Fire engulfs Wynnum home

props.synopsis: Family escapes house fire 'by the skin of their teeth' thanks to their dog who raised the alarm.

title.children: Family escapes fire 'by the skin of their teeth' thanks to pet dog
